meanings.definition: The act or process of transcribing or copying something.
meanings.sent1: I completed the transcription of the document.
meanings.sent2: The transcription of the speech was clear and easy to read.
meanings.sent3: The transcription of the meeting minutes made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her transcription of the song lyrics captured the emotions perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The transcription of the ancient text revealed hidden secrets.

meanings.definition: A written or printed version of something spoken or recorded.
meanings.sent1: Please provide me with a transcription of the interview.
meanings.sent2: The transcription of the podcast will be available online.
meanings.sent3: I lost the transcription of the phone call and now I can't remember what was said.
meanings.sent4: The transcription of the speech was so detailed, it felt like being there.
meanings.sent5: The transcription of the conversation highlighted important points.

meanings.definition: The process of transcribing genetic information from DNA to RNA.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the transcription of genetic material to understand diseases better.
meanings.sent2: The transcription of DNA plays a crucial role in protein synthesis.
meanings.sent3: The transcription of genetic data can be complex but fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The transcription of the genetic code is like a delicate dance of molecules.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the transcription of DNA is essential in biology research.
